title: React Framework
description: Learn how to build user interfaces with the React library

cards.question: What is React?
cards.answer: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, particularly single-page applications. It allows developers to create reusable UI components.

cards.question: What is JSX?
cards.answer: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript recommended by React. It looks similar to HTML and makes it easier to write and add HTML in React.

cards.question: What are props in React?
cards.answer: Props (properties) are read-only components that are passed from a parent component to a child component. They are immutable and help make components reusable.

cards.question: What is state in React?
cards.answer: State is a built-in React object used to store data or information about the component. Changes to state trigger re-rendering of the component.

cards.question: What are React Hooks?
cards.answer: React Hooks are functions that let you use state and other React features without writing a class component. Examples include useState, useEffect, useContext, etc.
